Package space.sunqian.fs.io.communicate

Interface ChannelReader<C extends ReadableByteChannel>

Type Parameters:
C - the type of the underlying channel
All Known Subinterfaces:
ChannelContext<C>, TcpClient, TcpContext
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractChannelContext
public interface ChannelReader<C extends ReadableByteChannel>
Channel reader for IO Communication, typically used for network or IPC (Inter-Process Communication).

The reader holds an underlying channel (can be accessed by channel()) to read and provides advanced read operations. If the read method of the underlying channel returns -1, it means the channel can no longer be read (for example: the TCP peer sent a FIN and entered the half-closed state). In this case, the channel can be closed to complete the close operation. If it returns 0, it indicates that all available data, for now, has been read, but the channel remains alive.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default byte @Nullable []
    availableBytes()
    Returns all available bytes in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed.
    default @Nullable String
    availableString()
    Returns all available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed.
    default @Nullable String
    availableString(@Nonnull Charset charset)
    Returns all available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed.
    C
    channel()
    Returns the underlying channel of this reader.

  • Method Details

    • availableBytes

      default byte @Nullable [] availableBytes() throws IORuntimeException
      Returns all available bytes in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed.
      Returns:
      the available bytes in the underlying channel, possibly empty, or null if the channel is closed.
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an error occurs

    • availableString

      @Nullable default @Nullable String availableString() throws IORuntimeException
      Returns all available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed. The string is decoded by the CharsKit.defaultCharset().
      Returns:
      the available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty, may be null if the channel is closed.
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an error occurs

    • availableString

      @Nullable default @Nullable String availableString(@Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset) throws IORuntimeException
      Returns all available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed. The string is decoded by the specified charset.
      Parameters:
      charset - the specified charset
      Returns:
      the available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty, may be null if the channel is closed.
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an error occurs
